item.title: Inox Green Energy Services Ltd Forms Death Cross, Signalling Bearish Trend Ahead
item.description: Inox Green Energy Services Ltd has recently formed a Death Cross, a significant technical indicator where the 50-day moving average (DMA) crosses below the 200-DMA. This development signals a potential shift towards a bearish trend, reflecting deteriorating momentum and raising concerns about the stock’s medium to long-term outlook. Time: 23 minutes ago

item.title: Hitachi Energy India Ltd Forms Golden Cross, Signalling Potential Bullish Breakout

item.title: Quarterly Earnings Review: Mixed Results as 46% of Stocks Report Positive Growth in Dec-2025
item.description: The December 2025 quarterly earnings season has unfolded with a nuanced picture, as 4,080 companies reported results reflecting a modest improvement in positive outcomes compared to previous quarters. While mid-cap firms continue to outperform with a 52.0% positive result rate, large caps lag behind at 43.0%, underscoring sectoral and size-based disparities in earnings momentum. Time: 23 minutes ago

item.title: Dev Information Technology Ltd Falls to 52-Week Low of Rs.26.7
item.description: Dev Information Technology Ltd’s shares declined sharply to a new 52-week low of Rs.26.7 on 18 Feb 2026, marking a significant drop amid continued underperformance relative to its sector and benchmark indices. Time: 2 hours ago

item.title: Baazar Style Retail Ltd Reports Robust Quarterly Growth Amid Sector Challenges
item.description: Baazar Style Retail Ltd has delivered a strong quarterly performance for the December 2025 quarter, showcasing significant revenue growth and margin expansion that marks a positive shift in its financial trend. Despite a recent downgrade in its Mojo Grade to Sell, the company’s operational metrics reveal a compelling turnaround compared to its historical averages, signalling renewed investor interest in the garments and apparels sector. Time: 2 hours ago

item.title: Mid-Cap Segment Edges Higher as Select Stocks Show Bullish Momentum
item.description: The BSE Midcap index edged higher by 0.45% on 18 February 2026, demonstrating resilience amid a mixed market backdrop. With 84 stocks advancing against 60 decliners, the segment’s breadth remained positive at a 1.4x advance-decline ratio, underscoring selective buying interest across sectors. Key technical upgrades and sectoral performances contributed to the modest gains, while investors await upcoming quarterly results for further directional cues. Time: 2 hours ago

item.title: Large-Cap Segment Shows Resilience with 0.41% Gain Amid Selective Upgrades
item.description: The large-cap segment, represented by the BSE 100 index, has demonstrated steady resilience with a modest gain of 0.41% on the day and a 0.12% rise over the past five sessions. This performance underscores a cautious but positive market sentiment, driven by selective strength among heavyweight stocks and a nuanced interplay between defensive and cyclical sectors. Time: 2 hours ago
